sub_title: Researcher, writer, adviser | Expert in diversity and inclusion in politics and beyond
summary:
📢 I am a researcher, writer and adviser on the intersections between politics & diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). 

📜 As a doctoral researcher (PhD candidate) in political science at the University of Amsterdam, I study the representation of women and ethnic minorities in politics (national & local) in The Netherlands. 

📚 With a strong interdisciplinary background and an all-round interest in the relationship between research and society at large, I am committed to building a more inclusive politics. I put this in practice by, amongst others, writing a monthly column for Binnenlands Bestuur about inclusivity and diversity.

🔹 I am a skilled science communicator, trained in youth leadership, NGO- and event-management. At the Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research, I was in charge of communications. Previously, I worked as a programmer for academic-cultural center SPUI25, and was the president of the European Youth Parliament the Netherlands.

treasury_media.title: Op weg naar een betere m/v-balans in politiek en bestuur
treasury_media.description: Waarom zijn - ondanks 100 jaar vrouwenkiesrecht - vrouwen in de politiek en het openbaar bestuur nog steeds de tweede sekse? En wat moet er gebeuren om politieke gelijkheid te vergroten? Dit essay zoekt antwoorden op deze vragen in internationaal wetenschappelijk onderzoek naar de vertegenwoordiging van vrouwen in de politiek.

education.degree_name: Bachelor (Honours Degree) in Liberal Arts and Sciences
education.field_of_study: Liberal Arts and Sciences, General Studies and Humanities

awards.title: Nominee 'You Go Girl' Award
awards.description: The inspiration prize You Go Girl Award is a prize for female experts who have taken effective steps to be more visible in their profession in the - including regional - media, radio, TV, in newspapers, magazines and social media. I was one of ten nominees for the year 2022.

awards.title: Nominee for the 2022 Rudolf Wildenmann Prize
awards.description: I was nominated for the 2022 Rudolf Wildenmann Prize. This prize is awarded in recognition of an outstanding Paper presented at the Joint Sessions of Workshops by an early career scholar: "Our jury were impressed with your achievements to date."

awards.title: Finalist NWO Synergy Award
awards.description: The Synergy Award is a pitching contest for PhD students on the best impact ideas for society from their own research. I was 1 of 4 finalists.

awards.title: UvA Talent Mentoring Programme
awards.description: Selected to take part in the UvA Talent Mentoring Programme as a mentee during one year

awards.title: Runner up Nanke Meuter Award 2014
awards.description: De Nanke Meuter Award is een prijs die jaarlijks wordt toegekend aan jonge Nederlanders die “Europa” actief onder de aandacht hebben gebracht en met hun inzet en activisme anderen hebben geïnspireerd.

profile_positions.description:
Freelance researcher and adviser. 

Amongst others as project manager for 'Alliantie Politica'. With the support of the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, several women’s organizations are working together in an 'Alliance' in the coming years to stimulate the political participation of women in all their diversity. The alliance does this, among others, by collaborating with governments and political parties, setting up training courses and networks, conducting research and learning from countries around us.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
I write a monthly column for Binnenlands Bestuur about diversity and inclusion. Binnenlands Bestuur is a journalistic platform for government officials and administrators and provides news, background and opinions on governance and policy.

After starting in 2022, my column (linked below) made it straight away to the top 10 most read of the year 2022.
profile_positions.title: Columnist

profile_positions.description:
Project title: "Political representation of women and ethnic minorities in the Netherlands".

I am a doctoral researcher in Political Science at the University of Amsterdam. My work focuses on the representation of women and ethnic minorities in politics and their representation in the media in the Netherlands. I especially investigate processes of political recruitment, inclusion and the importance of retention of politicians. 

I focus on the Netherlands, both on the national (Tweede Kamer) and local (Gemeente) level. The thesis is supervised by dr. Liza Mügge and co-supervised by prof. dr. Tom van der Meer and dr. Daphne van der Pas.

My thesis includes several applied research projects, funded by amongst others the Ministry of the Interior and Porticus.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher in Political Science

company.name: Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (University of Amsterdam)

profile_positions.company: Amsterdam Institute for Social Science Research (University of Amsterdam)
profile_positions.description:
My responsibilities included the management of the internal and external communications of the research institute. I was also a member of the institute's Management Team that decides on the strategic outlook of the institute. I supported and aligned the communications of the institute across the university and departments to communicate the research as widely as possible, as well as responsible for all events, liaison for press, stakeholders and sponsors.

The AISSR unites all social science research of the University of Amsterdam. The research programme focuses on the functioning of contemporary societies and their interrelationships from historical, comparative and empirical perspectives. The research programme is organised into thematically focused groups with an anchor in one or more of the represented disciplines: sociology, geography, planning & development studies, political science and anthropology.
profile_positions.title: Communications Officer & Member of Management Team

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for content and planning of events within the humanities, social sciences and economics as well as a broad range of external parties, approx. 150 per year. In this role, I developed and executed my own ideas for events as well as organized events commissioned by internal and external partners.

SPUI25, as the academic-cultural centre of the University of Amsterdam, connects the academic world with the cultural sector in the broadest sense. Almost daily, academics, writers, journalists, critics and creatives take the stage to discuss new findings in science and culture. The venue of SPUI25 hosts discussions, debates and interviews, as well as book presentations, lectures and award ceremonies. With its programmes, the centre targets both the academic community of researchers, lecturers, alumni and students, as well as a wide public with broad literary and cultural interests. 

In addition, SPUI25 organises events on bigger locations either to reach a larger audience, for which I was responsible during my time at SPUI25.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager

profile_positions.description: Tutoring at a primary school twice a week after school, focus mostly on (Dutch) language skills.
profile_positions.title: Homeworkcoach

volunteer_experiences.description: Stem op een Vrouw is a Dutch foundation, striving to improve the political representation and emancipation of women, by encouraging voters to vote strategically for women further down the candidate list. I am a volunteer for the Research Team.

The European Youth Parliament (EYP) is a unique educational programme which brings together young people from all over Europe to discuss current topics in a parliamentary setting. 

From 2009, I have been part of the organisation in many different roles, a selection: 
- 2016-2018 Member of the Supervisory Council
- 2014-2015 Elected Member of the Governing Body (Berlin, Germany)
- 2013-2015 Chair of the Regional Development Council
- 2012-2014 President of EYP the Netherlands
- 2011-2012 Organiser of the first International Session in the Netherlands, bringing together 300 young people from 30+ countries for 10 days. 

Next to management tasks, I also participated in conferences all over Europe as chair and facilitator. In this role, I facilitated policy discussions with hundreds of young people between 16-25 all over Europe; led week-long conferences with more than 150 participants; led trainings about group facilitation, EU governance, NGO management.
